section.title: Manage your dashboards
section.para: The dashboard is a tool developed internally to help you to see all your important information in one place. It collect and merge, with widget, information of your projects.

Dashboard offers the following features:
Merge information of all your projects
Create as many tabs you want to organize your widgets
Add as many widgets you want, and configure each one independently from other
There are 2 kind of dashboard in NovaForge, , which is specific to each user, and , which is specific to each project.

section.title: Dashboard User
section.para: Every user has one, and can only see its own. It's the first page you see, once you are loggued in. You can go to your dashboard, in left menu, in entry "My space".

section.title: Configure dashboard tabs
section.para: The button "+" of dashboard tabs bar, allow you to add a new tab to your dashboard.
On each tab, the button "triangle", on the right of the tab, allow you to open the tab configuration. Same button, when configuration menu is open, to close this menu.

section.title: Configure dashboard tabs
section.para: Configuration menu, allow you to define tab name, icon and layout. To define tab layout, you first have to choose how many area you want in this tab, and then how they are placed. To help you to identify where areas are, they are colored in blue, once the configuration menu is open. You can delete the current tab from the configuration menu (Widgets of this tab will be removed, and their configuration lost).

section.title: Add a widget
section.para: From the add widget menu, you can go back to .

you have the list of all availables widgets. You can search in this list, or filter by widget category. These categories are the same as application categories, a widget is linked, or not, to one or many categories.

You can add a widget to your dashboard by clicking on the "+" button on the bottom right corner of the widget thumbnail. By clicking on the widget thumbnail, you will get the widget description, and a preview, if there is one.
Once the widget is added to your dashboard, you can move it from one area to another, by dragging and dropping it.
The widget width is fit to the area width.

section.title: Commons widget actions
section.para:
On every widget you have an action bar, with these available actions (from left to right):
Refresh the widget
Go to widget configuration
Expand or collapse the widget
Remove the widget from your dashboard (configuration will be lost)

section.title: Dashboard Project
section.para: Each project have one, it's the homepage of the project, when you open it.
It's exactly the same behaviour of dashboard user, but only a project administrator can add/edit/remove and configure the tabs and the widgets.
A project member, will see only widgets that are linked with applications that he can see. For example, a widget linked with a svn, will be saw only by member who have the right to see the svn.
